title: Bayer Crop Science Facility - 2018 P2 Awardee | US EPA - U.S. EPA.gov
summary: Bayer's Crop Science Division in Kansas City, Missouri reduced wastewater generated from the washout of equipment used to formulate and package products by 25% over a three-year period. The improvements included better production scheduling, rerouting wash water, converting a formulation plant to a single product, installing new pipelines and pigging technology, and using spray nozzles. The reduced wastewater consumption saved Bayer $2.4 million over the three-year period.
likely_naics_codes: ['325310 - Pesticide, Fertilizer, and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing', '325411 - Medicinal and Botanical Manufacturing', '325412 - Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing', '325991 - Custom Compounding of Purchased Resins']

title: Q&A: The Truth About Those Plastic Recycling Labels - InsideClimate News
summary: The article discusses the problem of consumer confusion about what products are actually recyclable due to misleading labeling. The US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is working with the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to update the Green Guides, which provide guidance to companies on how to avoid greenwashing. The EPA is recommending that the FTC set a higher bar for what can be marketed as recyclable, requiring strong end markets for any products to be marketed as such.
green_innovation: TRUE; The article discusses the EPA's efforts to update the Green Guides to reduce consumer confusion about what products are actually recyclable. This is an example of green innovation because it aims to reduce environmental impacts by improving the accuracy of recycling labeling.
business_innovation: TRUE; The article discusses the EPA's efforts to update the Green Guides to reduce consumer confusion about what products are actually recyclable. This is an example of business innovation because it aims to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of recycling programs.
green_product: FALSE; The article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: FALSE; The article does not describe a specific green process.

title: Capex for FY24 includes a technology centre in Navi Mumbai and manufacturing site at Saykha: Dhiresh Shashikant Gosalia, CMD, Jesons Industries - Indian Chemical News
summary: Jesons Industries Limited is an Indian company that manufactures chemicals for the construction, textile, carpet, leather, and paper industries. The company is planning for 25% volume growth in FY24 and expects to increase its share of exports to 28% of overall revenues. Jesons Industries Limited is focused on Specialty Coating Emulsions (SCE) and water-based Pressure Sensitive Adhesives (PSA) in tape and label segments in India.

title: FinalStraw After Shark Tank Update 2024 - Where Are They Now - Gazette Review
summary: FinalStraw is a collapsible, reusable straw made of degradable material that helps the environment by reducing single-use plastic straws. The company was founded by Miles Pepper and Emma Cohen; they appeared on Shark Tank in season 10 but did not receive a deal. FinalStraw has since become a successful business with annual revenue of $7,000,000.
